keywords.term: Diocles of Carystus?; Pathos, aetia, therapeia

revisionDesc.change: Submit - Entered text from Marganne's edition and updated the meta-data.
Submit - Entered text from Marganne's edition and updated the meta-data.

div.p: Throughout the text Gerhard approximated the number of missing letters in the lacuna. Marganne does not follow this but prints a white space between the brackets. The presentation here in DCLP follows the practice of Gerhard, unless there is a difference. In The case of P.Hibeh 2.190 the same applies to Turners estimates of missing letters.
The supplements displayed here are Gerhard’s (except in P.Hibeh 2.190). Only when Marganne offers a different version, do we indicate both readings.
The supplements displayed in P.Hibeh 2.190 are Turner’s. only when Marganne offers a different version, do we indicate both readings.

item.p: we follow Gerhard. There are traces of Ink before the epsilon.
we follow Gerhard's reading. The ny is quite clear, the iota is more difficult to identify.
Gerhard reads συ]νβαίνοντος, but only ίνοντος is visible on the papyrus. Possibly this is due to the deterioration of the papyrus since his edition.

listBibl.bibl: R.Seider, Paläogr. griech. Papyri II.2, pl.IV
